Joan Miquel Gual, Tino Calabuig i Eva Fern√°ndez (expresidenta de la FAVB)
Cinef√≤rum El poble desnonat


'La ciudad es nuestra' √©s, probablement, el documental m√©s representatiu de les lluites pel dret a la ciutat impulsades des dels moviments socials urbans en els anys setanta a l‚ÄôEstat espanyol. Filmat abans de l‚Äôinici de la transici√≥ ‚Äìquan la Federaci√≥n Regional de Asociaciones de Vecinos de Madrid (FRAVM) encara no estava legalitzada‚Äì, mostra l‚Äôauge d‚Äôunes mobilitzacions que es van produir quan la conjuntura pol√≠tica encara estava oberta. S‚Äôhi reivindica una democr√†cia directa des de baix, protagonitzada per una ciutadania activa que pugui decidir tot all√≤ que est√† relacionat amb els barris i les ciutats:... escoles, espais p√∫blics, mobilitat, contaminaci√≥, seguretat, salut i habitatge. El film, fet mitjan√ßant entrevistes, constitueix un document molt important per entendre la pot√®ncia d‚Äôun moviment que va aconseguir moltes fites, precisament abans que fos desarticulat per l‚Äôarribada de la democr√†cia i la cooptaci√≥ de bona part de les i els seus millors activistes, que van passar a defensar interessos institucionals amb l‚Äôinici dels primers governs municipals.

Al debat posterior, comptarem amb la pres√®ncia del director i d‚Äôalgun activista ve√Ønal per parlar sobre la pel¬∑l√≠cula i posar-la en connexi√≥ amb el present.



Joan Miquel Gual √©s membre de Mem√≤ria en moviment, activista d‚Äôhabitatge a La Borda SCCL, professor d‚ÄôHist√≤ria del Cinema a la UOC i comissari del cicle El poble desnonat.

Tino Calabuig √©s artista i director de 'La ciudad es nuestra'

Eva Fern√†ndez √©s activista feminista i ve√Ønal. Va ser presidenta de la FAVB entre 2004 i 2010. Actualment exerceix doc√®ncia a l‚ÄôEUIT de Terrassa i pertany a l‚ÄôObservatori DESC. Ver m√°s

La Bombilla w/ Santana - Vernissage

Opening Solo Exhibition of Arte Santana on Thursday, 7th of June from 7PM at La Bombilla üí•

La Bombilla goes into a new era of Art.
Every month one artist will be the protagonist of the Art area of the bar.

This month we will welcome the Chilean artist Santana who will be pleased to precent his art during the opening of his solo!

About the artist: Arte Santana

Professional Chilean Actor and self-taught Painter, from a family of artists, both in the area of ‚Äã‚Äãmusic and decoration. He started in the world of painting after finishing the theater school. Submerged in the world of the abstract, he meets Jackson Pollock, his faithful reference, thus beginning his adventure in a...rt.

Dedicated to Action Painting gives us an abstract interpretation of the object in our times, where corporality becomes imperative, at the moment of transferring the visual sensation to the pictorial support, coming from the subconscious of the artist, letting his movements flow expressing the birth of a new work.

[eng] The 13th Barcelona Design Week will open its doors on the coming 5 June with an opening party aimed at all design, innovation and creativity lovers. Right after the conference given by Humberto Campana, the party will start with the opening of two unmissable exhibitions. ‚ÄòThe Best Design of the Year‚Äô, the exhibition for seeing and understanding what is going on in the world of design today in all of its expressions that features the shortlisted and prize-winning works of the awards presented by the FAD associations.
On the other hand, attendees will have also the opportunity to see first hand the space ‚ÄòBASICS: a walk to question ourselves‚Äô, organized by BCD, with several installations related to the central topic of the BDW, ‚ÄòRevalue‚Äô, and the 2030 Agenda with the United Nations‚Äô Objectives for Sustainable Development. This exhibition invites us to walk and ask questions about how each of us can positively contribute towards an individual and collective revaluation.

[CAST] La Barcelona Design Summit, organizada por BCD Barcelona Centro de Dise√±o, es un punto de encuentro imprescindible entre el sector empresarial y el dise√±o, una oportunidad para compartir conocimiento, descubrir tendencias e inspirarse de la mano de expertos de diversos √°mbitos y profesionales como la Dra Leyla Acaroglu, Champion of the Earth de la ONU, dise√±adora, soci√≥loga, Sustainability Provocateur y changemaker; Prof. Carlo Ratti, Director del SENSEABLE CITY LAB del MIT; Carla Cammilla Hjort, cofundadora y directora de SPACE 10; Johan Karlsson, cofundador y Director general de Better Shelter; Inge Keizer, Directora general de Edenspiekerman Barcelona, Jorge M√°rquez, Director de Experience Design en Everis, o Sameera Chukkapalli, fundadora de NEEDLAB.

En l√≠nea con el tema de la Barcelona Design Week 2018, ‚ÄòRevalorar‚Äò, y con nuestra visi√≥n de que el dise√±o puede contribuir a crear un mundo mejor, hemos escogido dos de los Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible de Naciones Unidas de la Agenda 2030 como principales temas de debate y reflexi√≥n: Por un lado, promover el consumo y la producci√≥n responsable y, por otro, construir ciudades y comunidades m√°s inclusivas, seguras, resilientes y sostenibles.

Mediante dos jornadas de conferencias que se llevar√°n a cabo el 6 y 7 de junio, el congreso plantear√° diversas cuestiones sobre c√≥mo deber√≠a evolucionar el actual modelo de producci√≥n y consumo, c√≥mo hemos de consumir en el presente para lograr un futuro sostenible o el efecto colectivo de nuestras acciones individuales. Ponentes de reconocido prestigio internacional compartir√°n sus historias de √©xito y visiones inspiradoras de c√≥mo el dise√±o puede crear empresas m√°s sostenibles, conectar con comunidades y mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas.

La Barcelona Design Summit incluir√° tambi√©n el Workshop ‚ÄòDesign Led Systems Change & Sustainability‚Äô, una sesi√≥n dirigida a todo el que quiera aprender a valorar de formar cr√≠tica la manera en que se dan los cambios tanto a nivel micro como macro, y a explorar nuevos enfoques a la hora de integrar criterios sostenibles en la toma de decisiones profesionales.

[ENG] The Barcelona Design Summit, organised by the Barcelona Design Centre (BCD), is an unmissable event between the business and design sectors, an opportunity to share knowledge, discover trends and be inspired by experts from different fields and professions such as Dr Leyla Acaroglu, U.N Champion of the Earth, Designer, Sociologist, Sustainability Provocateur, Changemaker; Prof. Carlo Ratti, Director of the SENSEABLE CITY LAB at MIT; Carla Cammilla Hjort, Co-founder and Director of SPACE 10; Johan Karlsson, Co-founder and Managing Director of Better Shelter; Inge Keizer, Managing director of Edenspiekerman Barcelona; Jorge M√°rquez, Head of Experience Design at Everis, and Sameera Chukkapalli, Founder of NEEDLAB.

In line with the topic of Barcelona Design Week 2018, ‚ÄúRevaluate‚Äú, and with our vision that design can contribute to creating a better world, we have chosen the United Nations‚Äô Objectives for Sustainable Development from the 2030 Agenda as the main topics for debate and reflection: On the one hand, promoting responsible consumption and production, and on the other constructing more inclusive, safer, more resilient and more sustainable cities and communities.

Over two conference days that will take place on the 6 and 7 June, the event will put forward different questions about how we should develop the current model of production and consumption, how we must consume in the present to achieve a sustainable future and the collective effect of our individual actions. Speakers of recognised international prestige with share their success stories and inspiring visions of how design can create more sustainable companies, connect with communities and improve people‚Äôs quality of life.

The Barcelona Design Summit will also include the ‚ÄòDesign Led Systems Change & Sustainability‚Äô workshop, a session aimed at everything you would want to learn to critically assess the way in which changes occur at both a micro and macro level and exploring new approaches to integrating sustainable criteria in professional decision-making.

The conferences will take place in the Disseny Hub Barcelona Auditorium. The workshop and interaction between the speakers and those attending will take place in the ‚ÄúBASICS: a walk to question ourselves‚Äù Exhibition.

Joan Pere Viladecans (Barcelona, 1948) celebra, enguany, el cinquant√® aniversari de la seva primera exposici√≥ a Barcelona. Despr√©s d‚Äôuna intensa traject√≤ria expositiva, Viladecans presenta als Espais Volart ‚ÄúUna mirada interior. Una mirada interior?‚Äù, una mostra que sorteja els l√≠mits establerts entre la ci√®ncia, el pensament i l‚Äôart amb l‚Äôobjectiu de formular-nos noves preguntes entorn dels l√≠mits entre els diferents conceptes.

Avantposant el pensament a la pintura, l‚Äôautor estableix un di√†leg entre el llenguatge, el gest pict√≤ric i la representaci√≥ de la realitat, reprodu√Øda i manipulada a trav√©s de l‚Äôestampaci√≥ digital. Algunes de les obres, realitzades al damunt de radiografies ampliades de diverses parts ...del cos, converteixen les s√≠ndromes, les imperfeccions, les patologies i les fractures en elements art√≠stics que ens conviden a submergir-nos a l‚Äôinterior dels nostres cossos, com si fossin criptes, per escorcollar-nos millor.

Joan Pere Viladecans (Barcelona, 1948) celebra, este a√±o, el cincuenta aniversario de su primera exposici√≥n en Barcelona. Despu√©s de una intensa trayectoria expositiva, Viladecans presenta en los Espais Volart ‚ÄúUna mirada interior. ¬øUna mirada interior?‚Äù, una muestra que sortea los l√≠mites establecidos entre la ciencia, el pensamiento y el arte con el objetivo de formularnos nuevas preguntas en torno a los l√≠mites entre los diferentes conceptos.

Anteponiendo el pensamiento a la pintura, el autor establece un di√°logo entre el lenguaje, el gesto pict√≥rico y la representaci√≥n de la realidad, reproducida y manipulada a trav√©s de la estampaci√≥n digital. Algunas de las obras, realizadas sobre radiograf√≠as ampliadas de varias partes del cuerpo, convierten los s√≠ndromes, las imperfecciones, las patolog√≠as y las fracturas en elementos art√≠sticos que nos invitan a sumergirnos en el interior de nuestros cuerpos, como si fueran criptas, para explorarnos mejor.
